exceptions.description: There is no current webpage or the element does not exist.

tools.name: InputText
tools.summary: Inputs multiple text into specified input fields.

parameters.name: elements_and_texts
parameters.description: A list of objects, each includes 'element_id' (string, the id of the input field) and 'text' (string, the text to input).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the input was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: At least one of the elements is not an input field or the text is not a string.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: There is no current webpage or at least one of the elements does not exist.

tools.name: ClickElement
tools.summary: Clicks an element in the current web page.

parameters.name: element_id
parameters.description: The id of the element to click.

returns.name: result
returns.description: The result of the click action, including 'success' (boolean), 'current_url' (string, the URL of the new webpage if the click action triggers a page navigation), and 'snippet' (string, the snippet of the new webpage if the click action triggers a page navigation), 'download_file' (string, the file path of the downloaded file if the click action triggers a file download).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The element does not exist or there is no current webpage.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The element is not clickable.

tools.name: SearchHistory
tools.summary: Searches the browsing history.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

returns.name: history
returns.description: The matching history entries. Each history entry is an object with fields 'url' (string) and 'browse_time' (string, in the format of 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS').

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The provided query is not valid.

tools.name: ClearHistory
tools.summary: Clears the browsing history.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

description_for_model: A toolkit for managing and protecting online passwords and personal information. It provides tools for storing, generating, auto-filling, searching, sharing, importing, and exporting passwords, as well as storing, auto-filling, and retrieving personal information. It also supports two-factor authentication for added security.
description_for_human: Toolkit for managing and protecting online passwords and personal information.

tools.name: StorePassword
tools.summary: Store a new password securely.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password to store.

parameters.name: website
parameters.description: The website associated with the password.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username associated with the password.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'password', 'website', or 'username' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: CheckPasswordStrength
tools.summary: Check the strength of a password.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password to check.

returns.name: strength
returns.description: The strength of the password, possible values: 'weak', 'medium', 'strong'.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'password' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: GeneratePassword
tools.summary: Generate a unique password.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: The length of the generated password. Default is 12.

parameters.name: include_symbols
parameters.description: Whether to include symbols in the generated password. Default is true.

parameters.name: include_numbers
parameters.description: Whether to include numbers in the generated password. Default is true.

parameters.name: include_uppercase
parameters.description: Whether to include uppercase letters in the generated password. Default is true.

parameters.name: include_lowercase
parameters.description: Whether to include lowercase letters in the generated password. Default is true.

parameters.name: strength
parameters.description: The strength of the generated password, must be one of ['weak', 'medium', 'strong'].

returns.name: generated_password
returns.description: The generated password.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'strength' parameter is not one of ['weak', 'medium', 'strong'].

tools.name: AutoFillPassword
tools.summary: Auto-fill the password on a specified website.

parameters.name: website
parameters.description: The website to auto-fill the password on.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The password for the specified website is not found.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'website' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: SearchPasswords
tools.summary: Search and retrieve stored passwords.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: passwords
returns.description: A list of objects, each object contains 'website', 'username', and 'password'.

tools.name: StorePersonalInfo
tools.summary: Store personal information such as addresses and payment details.

parameters.name: info_type
parameters.description: The type of personal information, must be one of ['address', 'payment'].

parameters.name: info_data
parameters.description: The personal information data. For 'address', the object should contain 'street', 'city', 'state', 'zip_code'. For 'payment', the object should contain 'card_number', 'expiry_date', 'cvv'.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'info_type' parameter is not one of ['address', 'payment'] or the 'info_data' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: AutoFillPersonalInfo
tools.summary: Auto-fill personal information on a specified website.

parameters.name: website
parameters.description: The website to auto-fill the personal information on.

parameters.name: info_type
parameters.description: The type of personal information, must be one of ['address', 'payment'].

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The personal information for the specified info_type is not found.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'website' or 'info_type' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: RetrievePersonalInfo
tools.summary: Retrieve stored personal information based on the info type.

parameters.name: info_type
parameters.description: The type of personal information, must be one of ['address', 'payment'].

returns.name: info_data
returns.description: The personal information data. For 'address', the object contains 'street', 'city', 'state', 'zip_code'. For 'payment', the object contains 'card_number', 'expiry_date', 'cvv'.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The personal information for the specified info_type is not found.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'info_type' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: SharePassword
tools.summary: Share a stored password securely with a trusted contact.

parameters.name: website
parameters.description: The website associated with the password to share.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username associated with the password to share.

parameters.name: contact_email
parameters.description: The email address of the trusted contact.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The password for the specified website and username is not found.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'website', 'username', or 'contact_email' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: ImportPasswords
tools.summary: Import password data from a file.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The local file path of the password data file.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'file_path' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: ExportPasswords
tools.summary: Export stored password data to a file.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The local file path to save the exported password data.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'file_path' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: EnableTwoFactorAuthentication
tools.summary: Enable two-factor authentication for added security.

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: The phone number to receive authentication codes.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'phone_number' parameter is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: DisableTwoFactorAuthentication
tools.summary: Disable two-factor authentication.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation was successful.

description_for_model: Used for controlling and managing the August Smart Lock, specifically installed on the front door of the user's residence. It provides tools to lock and unlock the door, check the lock status, add and delete guests, grant and revoke access for guests, generate and revoke access codes, and view access history.
description_for_human: Toolkit for controlling and managing August Smart Lock.

tools.name: CheckLockStatus
tools.summary: Retrieves the current lock status of the door.

returns.name: lock_status
returns.description: The lock status of the door, either 'locked' or 'unlocked'.

errors.name: PotentialThreatError
errors.description: The lock senses a threat and cannot provide information.

tools.name: LockDoor
tools.summary: Locks the door.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the door was locked successfully or not.

errors.name: UserUnverifiedError
errors.description: The user is not verified.

errors.name: MissingPasswordError
errors.description: The user must input a password in order to lock the door.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The door is already locked.

tools.name: UnlockDoor
tools.summary: Unlocks the door.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the door was unlocked successfully or not.

errors.name: UserUnverifiedError
errors.description: The user is not verified.

errors.name: MissingPasswordError
errors.description: The user must input a password in order to unlock the door.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The door is already unlocked.

tools.name: SearchGuests
tools.summary: Searches for guests by name in the system.

parameters.name: name_keyword
parameters.description: Keyword of the guest name to search for.

returns.name: guests
returns.description: An array of objects, each object contains 'guest_id' (string), 'guest_name' (string), and 'guest_email' (string).

errors.name: PermissionDeniedError
errors.description: The user does not have permission to search for guests.

errors.name: MaxGuestsExceededError
errors.description: There are too many guests to search over.

tools.name: AddGuest
tools.summary: Adds a guest to the system.

parameters.name: guest_name
parameters.description: Name of the guest to add.

parameters.name: guest_email
parameters.description: Email address of the guest to add.

returns.name: guest_id
returns.description: Unique identifier of the added guest.

errors.name: PermissionDeniedError
errors.description: The user does not have permission to add a guest.

errors.name: MaxGuestsExceededError
errors.description: There are too many guests already added.

errors.name: GuestUnverifiedError
errors.description: The guest has not yet been verified.

errors.name: GuestMissingError
errors.description: The guest is not part of the User's contacts.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The guest already exists.

tools.name: DeleteGuest
tools.summary: Deletes a guest from the system.

parameters.name: guest_ids
parameters.description: An array of guest IDs to delete.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the guest was deleted successfully or not.

errors.name: PermissionSupersededError
errors.description: The user does not have the authority to delete the guest.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: At least one of the guest IDs does not exist.

tools.name: GrantGuestAccess
tools.summary: Grants permanent or temporary access to guests. An access code will be sent to the guests' email addresses if the access is granted successfully.

parameters.name: guest_ids
parameters.description: An array of guest IDs to grant access to.

parameters.name: permanent
parameters.description: Whether to grant permanent access or not.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start time of the access period in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm format, required for granting temporary access.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time of the access period in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm format, required for granting temporary access.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the access was granted successfully or not.

errors.name: PermissionDeniedError
errors.description: The user does not have permission to grant access.

errors.name: MaxGuestsExceededError
errors.description: There are too many guests with access.

errors.name: GuestUnverifiedError
errors.description: The guest has not yet been verified.

errors.name: GuestMissingError
errors.description: The guest is not part of the User's contacts.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: At least one of the guest IDs does not exist.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The access has already been granted.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The start_time and end_time are invalid or the start_time is later than the end_time, or the start_time and end_time are not provided when granting temporary access.

tools.name: RevokeGuestAccess
tools.summary: Revokes access for a guest.

parameters.name: guest_ids
parameters.description: An array of guest IDs to revoke access for.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the access was revoked successfully or not.

errors.name: PermissionDeniedError
errors.description: The user does not have permission to revoke access.

errors.name: UnverifiedGuestError
errors.description: The guest has not yet been verified.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: At least one of the guest IDs does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The access has not been granted.

tools.name: GenerateTemporaryAccessCode
tools.summary: Generates a temporary access code that can be used to unlock the door for a specified period of time.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start time of the access period in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm format.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time of the access period in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm format.

returns.name: access_code
returns.description: The generated temporary access code.

errors.name: MaxCodesExceededError
errors.description: There are too many access codes.

errors.name: CodeUnverifiedError
errors.description: The access code has not yet been verified.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The start_time and end_time are invalid or the start_time is later than the end_time.

tools.name: RevokeTemporaryAccessCode
tools.summary: Revokes a temporary access code.

parameters.name: access_code
parameters.description: The temporary access code to revoke.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the access code was revoked successfully or not.

errors.name: UnverifiedAccessCodeError
errors.description: The access code has not yet been verified.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The access code does not exist.

tools.name: ViewAccessHistory
tools.summary: Retrieves access history.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: Start time of the history period in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm format.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: End time of the history period in YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm format.

returns.name: access_history
returns.description: An array of access history events with details including guest id, guest name, guest email, access time.

errors.name: PermissionDeniedError
errors.description: The user does not have permission to view access history.

errors.name: InvalidAccessError
errors.description: The lock detected a breach of security and cannot provide access history.

description_for_model: The IFTTT toolkit connect different services together using applets. Each applet defines a relationship between a trigger and an action, where the action is performed when the trigger is triggered. It allows users to create and manage applets, discover pre-built applets, enable/disable applets, list connected services, and search for available triggers and actions. It supports a wide range of services including social media platforms, email services, IoT devices, and more.
description_for_human: Toolkit for creating and managing IFTTT applets and connected services.

tools.name: SearchConnectedServices
tools.summary: Search services that are connected to the user's IFTTT account by keywords.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords to search for connected services, e.g., 'Twitter', 'Gmail', 'Weather'.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return, default is 5.

returns.name: connected_services
returns.description: An array of connected services that match the keywords, each object contains 'service_name' and 'service_description'.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'keyword' is empty or invalid, or the 'max_results' is not a positive integer.

tools.name: SearchTriggers
tools.summary: Search for available triggers by keywords for a specific connected service. The triggers are something that happens on the service, e.g., a new tweet, a new email, a new weather forecast.

parameters.name: service_name
parameters.description: The service to search for triggers, e.g., 'Twitter', 'Gmail', 'Weather'. Must be an existing connected service returned by ListConnectedServices.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords to search for triggers, e.g., 'new tweet', 'received email', 'temperature'.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return, default is 10.

returns.name: triggers
returns.description: An array of available triggers matching the keywords, each trigger includes 'service_name' (str, the service name, e.g., 'Twitter'), 'trigger_name' (str, the trigger name, e.g., 'new tweet from user'), 'trigger_description' (str, the trigger description), and 'trigger_parameters' (object, the description of the parameters required for the trigger, e.g., a key 'user_name' with value 'str, the user name', empty if no parameters are required).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'service_name' or 'keywords' argument is not a valid string or the 'max_results' argument is not a valid integer.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'service_name' argument is not an existing connected service.

tools.name: SearchActions
tools.summary: Search for available actions by keywords for a specific connected service. The actions are something that can be done on the service, e.g., post a tweet, send an email, turn on a light.

parameters.name: service_name
parameters.description: The service to search for actions, e.g., 'Twitter', 'Gmail', 'Hue'. Must be an existing connected service returned by ListConnectedServices.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: Keywords to search for actions, e.g., 'post tweet', 'send email', 'turn on light'.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to return, default is 10.

returns.name: actions
returns.description: An array of available actions matching the keywords, each action includes 'service_name' (str, the service name, e.g., 'Twitter'), 'action_name' (str, the action name, e.g., 'post tweet'), 'action_description' (str, the action description), and 'action_parameters' (object, the description of the parameters required for the action, e.g., a key 'tweet' with value 'str, the tweet content', empty if no parameters required).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'service_name' or 'keywords' argument is not a valid string or the 'max_results' argument is not a valid integer.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'service_name' argument is not an existing connected service.

tools.name: CreateApplet
tools.summary: Create a new applet with a specified trigger and action. Once the trigger is activated, the action will be performed.

parameters.name: trigger_service_name
parameters.description: The service of the trigger for the applet, e.g., 'Twitter'. Must be an existing connected service returned by ListConnectedServices.

parameters.name: trigger_name
parameters.description: The specific trigger from the service for the applet, e.g., 'new tweet from user'. Must be an existing trigger returned by SearchTriggers for the specified service.

parameters.name: trigger_parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the trigger. Must be a valid object matching the description returned by SearchTriggers for the specified trigger.

parameters.name: action_service_name
parameters.description: The service of the action for the applet, e.g., 'Gmail'. Must be an existing connected service returned by ListConnectedServices.

parameters.name: action_name
parameters.description: The specific action from the service to perform when the trigger is activated, e.g., 'send an email'. Must be an existing action returned by SearchActions for the specified service.

parameters.name: action_parameters
parameters.description: The parameters for the action. Must be a valid object matching the description returned by SearchActions for the specified action.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the applet was successfully created.

returns.name: applet_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the created applet. Empty if the applet was not successfully created.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'trigger_parameters' does not match the parameter required by the specified 'trigger_name' or the 'action_parameters' does not match the parameter required by the specified 'action_name'.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified 'trigger_service_name', 'trigger_name', 'action_service_name', or 'action_name' does not exist.

tools.name: SearchApplets
tools.summary: Search for applets matching the specified criteria.

parameters.name: trigger_keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to search for in the trigger name. If not specified, all triggers will be considered.

parameters.name: action_keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to search for in the action name. If not specified, all actions will be considered.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of applets to return.

returns.name: applets
returns.description: The list of applets matching the specified criteria, each is an object containing 'applet_id', 'trigger_service_name', 'trigger_name', 'trigger_parameters', 'action_service_name', 'action_name', and 'action_parameters'.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The specified 'max_results' is not a positive integer.

tools.name: UpdateApplet
tools.summary: Update an existing applet with new trigger and action settings.

parameters.name: applet_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the applet to update.

parameters.name: trigger_service_name
parameters.description: The new service of the trigger for the applet, e.g., 'Twitter'. Must be an existing connected service returned by ListConnectedServices.

parameters.name: trigger_name
parameters.description: The new trigger from the service for the applet, e.g., 'new tweet from user'. Must be an existing trigger returned by SearchTriggers for the specified service.

parameters.name: trigger_parameters
parameters.description: The new parameters for the trigger. Must be a valid object matching the description returned by SearchTriggers for the specified trigger.

parameters.name: action_service_name
parameters.description: The new service of the action for the applet, e.g., 'Gmail'. Must be an existing connected service returned by ListConnectedServices.

parameters.name: action_name
parameters.description: The new action from the service to perform when the trigger is activated, e.g., 'send an email'. Must be an existing action returned by SearchActions for the specified service.

parameters.name: action_parameters
parameters.description: The new parameters for the action. Must be a valid object matching the description returned by SearchActions for the specified action.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the applet update was successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'trigger_parameters' does not match the parameter required by the specified 'trigger_name' or the 'action_parameters' does not match the parameter required by the specified 'action_name'.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified 'trigger_service_name', 'trigger_name', 'action_service_name', or 'action_name' does not exist, or the specified 'applet_id' does not exist.

tools.name: DeleteApplets
tools.summary: Delete the specified applets.

parameters.name: applet_ids
parameters.description: The list of unique identifiers of the applets to delete.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Indicates whether the applet deletion was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The specified 'applet_ids' does not exist.

description_for_model: A toolkit for managing and organizing notes, documents, and web clippings using Evernote, including creating, reading, updating, deleting, searching, tagging, and sharing notes and notebooks. It also allows users to control the level of sharing of notes with other users.
description_for_human: Toolkit for managing and organizing notes and documents using Evernote.

tools.name: CreateNote
tools.summary: Create a new note with a title, content, and optional attachments.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the note.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The content of the note.

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: Local file paths of attachments (optional).

parameters.name: notebook_id
parameters.description: The ID of the notebook to add the note to (optional).

returns.name: note_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the created note.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The title or content is empty or the attachments have invalid file paths.

tools.name: ReadNote
tools.summary: Retrieve the content of a note by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: note_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the note.

returns.name: note
returns.description: An object containing the note's title, snippet, content, attachments, notebook_id, and tags.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The note_id does not exist.

tools.name: UpdateNote
tools.summary: Update the content, title, or attachments of a note by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: note_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the note.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The new title of the note (optional).

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The new content of the note (optional).

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: Local file paths of new attachments (optional).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the update was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The note_id does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The attachments have invalid file paths.

tools.name: DeleteNote
tools.summary: Delete a note by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: note_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the note.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the deletion was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The note_id does not exist.

tools.name: CreateNotebook
tools.summary: Create a new notebook with a name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the notebook.

returns.name: notebook_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the created notebook.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The name is empty.

tools.name: ReadNotebook
tools.summary: Retrieve the content of a notebook by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: notebook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the notebook.

returns.name: notebook
returns.description: An object containing the notebook's name and an array of note_id.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The notebook_id does not exist.

tools.name: UpdateNotebook
tools.summary: Update the name of a notebook by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: notebook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the notebook.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name of the notebook.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the update was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The notebook_id does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The name is empty.

tools.name: DeleteNotebook
tools.summary: Delete a notebook by its unique identifier.

parameters.name: notebook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the notebook.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the deletion was successful.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The notebook_id does not exist.

tools.name: SearchNotes
tools.summary: Search for notes by keywords, tags, or notebook ID.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: A list of keywords to search for in the note title or content (optional).

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: A list of tags to search for in the note tags (optional).

parameters.name: notebook_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the notebook to search within (optional).

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return (optional, default: 10).

returns.name: notes
returns.description: A list of note objects, each includes note_id, title, and snippet.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The max_results is not a positive integer.

tools.name: ManageNoteSharingLevel
tools.summary: Alter the note-sharing permissions for a specific user identified by their email address.

parameters.name: note_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the note that the permissions will be changed for.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address of the user whose note-sharing permissions will be altered.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The level of sharing, can be 'not_accessible', 'read_only', or 'can_edit'.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the sharing permissions for the note were successfully updated.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The note_id does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The email is invalid or the level is not one of 'not_accessible', 'read_only', or 'can_edit'.

tools.name: SearchNotebooks
tools.summary: Search for notebooks by keywords or name.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: A list of keywords to search for in the notebook name (optional).

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the notebook to search for (optional).

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return (optional, default: 10).

returns.name: notebooks
returns.description: A list of notebook objects, each includes notebook_id and name.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The max_results is not a positive integer.

description_for_model: A toolkit for managing Slack interactions, including sending messages, managing channels, searching for messages, channels, and users, uploading and downloading files, and managing user profiles and statuses.
description_for_human: Toolkit for managing Slack interactions.

tools.name: SendMessage
tools.summary: Send a message and optional file to a channel or user.

parameters.name: recipient
parameters.description: The name of the recipient, channel name starts with '#', e.g., '#general', or user name starts with '@', e.g., '@john'.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The content of the message.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: The local file path of the file to upload (optional).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the message was sent successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'recipient' is in an invalid format, or the 'message' is empty.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'recipient' does not exist, or the 'file_path' does not exist.

tools.name: CreateChannel
tools.summary: Create a new channel.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: The name of the channel, must start with '#'.

parameters.name: is_public
parameters.description: Whether the channel is public. Default is public.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the channel was created successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'channel_name' is empty or in an invalid format.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: A channel with the same 'channel_name' already exists.

tools.name: JoinChannel
tools.summary: Join an existing channel.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: The name of the channel, must start with '#'.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the user joined the channel successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'channel_name' does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'channel_name' is empty or in an invalid format, or the user is already a member of the channel.

tools.name: LeaveChannel
tools.summary: Leave a channel.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: The name of the channel, must start with '#'.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the user left the channel successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'channel_name' is empty or in an invalid format, or the user is not a member of the channel.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'channel_name' does not exist.

tools.name: SearchMessage
tools.summary: Search for messages in a channel or direct messages.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: in
parameters.description: The channel name or user name to search within, must start with '#' (for channels) or '@' (for users). When not specified, search all channels and direct messages.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The user name to search for, must start with '@'. When not specified, search all users.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: messages
returns.description: The search results, each object includes 'content' (string, the content of the message), 'timestamp' (string, the timestamp of the message in ISO 8601 format), 'in' (string, the channel name or user name), 'from' (string, the user name of the sender), and 'file_id' (string, the unique identifier of the file if the message is a file).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'in' or 'from' argument is not a valid string or the 'max_results' argument is not a valid integer.

tools.name: SearchChannelOrUser
tools.summary: Search for channels or users by query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The search query.

parameters.name: search_type
parameters.description: One of ['channels', 'users'], the type of resources to search.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: results
returns.description: A list of objects indicating the search results, each object includes 'name' (string, the name of the channel or user), 'status' (string, one of ['member', 'non-member', 'owner'] for channels, 'online' or 'offline' for users).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'search_type' is not one of ['channels', 'users'], the 'max_results' is not a positive integer.

tools.name: UpdateProfileAndStatus
tools.summary: Update the user's profile and status.

parameters.name: status_text
parameters.description: The status text.

parameters.name: status_emoji
parameters.description: The status emoji.

parameters.name: presence
parameters.description: One of ['auto', 'away'], the presence status.

parameters.name: profile
parameters.description: The profile to update, includes 'first_name' (string), 'last_name' (string), 'email' (string), 'phone' (string), 'local_time' (string), 'title' (string).

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the profile and status were updated successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'status_text' or 'status_emoji' is inappropriate, the 'presence' is not one of ['auto', 'away'], or the 'profile' contains incorrect or inappropriate information.

tools.name: ManageMembership
tools.summary: Add or remove users from a channel. This tool is only valid when the user is the owner of the group.

parameters.name: channel_name
parameters.description: The name of the channel, must start with '#'.

parameters.name: user_name
parameters.description: The name of the user to add or remove, must start with '@'.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: One of ['add', 'remove'], the action to perform.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the membership was managed successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'channel_name' or 'user_name' is empty or in an invalid format, or the 'action' is not one of ['add', 'remove'], or the channel is not owned by the user.

tools.name: GetUserDetails
tools.summary: Retrieve the profile and status of a user.

parameters.name: user_name
parameters.description: The name of the user, must start with '@'.

returns.name: profile
returns.description: The profile of the user, includes 'first_name' (string), 'last_name' (string), 'email' (string), 'phone' (string), 'local_time' (string), 'title' (string).

returns.name: status
returns.description: The status of the user, includes 'status_text' (string), 'status_emoji' (string), 'presence' (string).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'user_name' is empty or in an invalid format.

tools.name: DownloadFile
tools.summary: Download a file using its unique identifier.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the file.

parameters.name: save_path
parameters.description: The local path to save the file.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the file was downloaded successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'file_id' is incorrect or the 'save_path' is invalid.

description_for_model: A toolkit for Twilio services, enabling users to send SMS messages, retrieve communication history, manage scheduled actions, retrieve information about specific phone numbers, and retrieve the history of received SMS messages.
description_for_human: Toolkit for Twilio services.

tools.name: SendSms
tools.summary: Send an SMS message to one or multiple specified phone numbers.

parameters.name: to_phone_numbers
parameters.description: A list of phone numbers in E.164 format to send the SMS message to.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The content of the SMS message.

parameters.name: scheduled_time
parameters.description: The scheduled time for sending the SMS message in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss'. Optional.

parameters.name: is_recurring
parameters.description: Whether the SMS message should be sent on a recurring basis. Default is false.

parameters.name: recurrence
parameters.description: The recurrence rule in RRULE format, required if 'is_recurring' is true.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the SMS message was sent successfully.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'to_phone_numbers' or 'message' parameter is invalid, the 'scheduled_time' parameter is not in the correct format, or the 'is_recurring' parameter is true but the 'recurrence' parameter is not properly set.

tools.name: GetSmsHistory
tools.summary: Retrieve the history of sent SMS messages.

parameters.name: to_phone_number
parameters.description: The phone number in E.164 format to retrieve the history for. If not specified, the history for all phone numbers will be retrieved.

parameters.name: datetime_range
parameters.description: A list of two timestamps in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss' to retrieve the history between. If not specified, the history for all timestamps will be retrieved.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The comma-separated keywords to search for in the message content. If not specified, no keyword filtering will be performed.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve. Optional.

returns.name: sms_history
returns.description: A list of objects containing the 'to_phone_number', 'message', and 'timestamp' of each sent SMS message.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'to_phone_number' parameter is invalid, the 'datetime_range' parameter is not in the correct format, or the 'max_results' parameter is not a positive integer.

tools.name: GetReceivedSmsMessages
tools.summary: Retrieve the history of received SMS messages.

parameters.name: from_phone_number
parameters.description: The phone number in E.164 format to retrieve the history for. If not specified, the history for all phone numbers will be retrieved.

parameters.name: datetime_range
parameters.description: A list of two timestamps in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss' to retrieve the history between. If not specified, the history for all timestamps will be retrieved.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The comma-separated keywords to search for in the message content. If not specified, no keyword filtering will be performed.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve. Optional.

returns.name: received_messages
returns.description: A list of objects containing the 'from_phone_number', 'message', and 'timestamp' of each received message or phone call.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'from_phone_number' parameter is invalid, the 'datetime_range' parameter is not in the correct format, or the 'max_results' parameter is not a positive integer.

tools.name: GetSmsPricing
tools.summary: Retrieve the costs per text for different country codes.

parameters.name: country_code
parameters.description: The country code to retrieve the costs for.

returns.name: pricing
returns.description: An object containing the 'country_code' and 'cost_per_text' for the specified country code.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'country_code' parameter is invalid.

tools.name: GetPhoneNumberInfo
tools.summary: Retrieve information about a specific phone number.

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: The phone number in E.164 format to retrieve information for.

returns.name: phone_number_info
returns.description: An object containing the 'phone_number', 'country', 'carrier', and 'type' of the specified phone number.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'phone_number' parameter is not found.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'phone_number' parameter is invalid.

tools.name: GetScheduledActions
tools.summary: Retrieve the list of scheduled actions.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve. Optional.

returns.name: scheduled_actions
returns.description: A list of objects containing the 'action_type', 'to_phone_number', 'message', and 'scheduled_time' of each scheduled action.

tools.name: CancelScheduledAction
tools.summary: Cancel a scheduled action.

parameters.name: action_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the scheduled action to cancel.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the scheduled action was canceled successfully.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'action_id' parameter is not found.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'action_id' parameter is invalid.

description_for_model: A toolkit that provides functionalities for getting current location, searching locations, getting location details, getting directions, geocoding, getting location reviews, and managing the address book.
description_for_human: Toolkit for searching locations, getting location details, getting directions, geocoding, and managing the address book.

tools.name: GetCurrentLocation
tools.summary: Get the current location of the user.

returns.name: location_address
returns.description: The current location of the user in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'.

tools.name: SearchLocations
tools.summary: Search for locations using keywords, distance, open status, and rating.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to search for locations.

parameters.name: open_now
parameters.description: Whether the location is open now. Default is not applying the open filter.

parameters.name: min_rating
parameters.description: The minimum rating of the location. Default is not applying the rating filter. Should be a number between 0 and 5.

parameters.name: base_location_address
parameters.description: The base location address to search for locations and calculate the distance, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'. Default is the current location.

parameters.name: max_distance
parameters.description: The distance in miles within which to search for locations. Default is not applying the distance filter.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: locations
returns.description: The array of locations, each of which is a dictionary containing the 'location_name', 'location_address' (in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'), 'location_rating', and 'location_distance' (in miles) of the location to the base location, and 'open_now' (optional, indicate whether the location is open now).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'keywords' argument is empty, or the 'min_rating' argument is not a number between 0 and 5, or the 'max_distance' argument is not a positive number, or the 'max_results' argument is not a positive integer, or the 'base_location_address' is not in the valid format.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'base_location_address' does not exist.

tools.name: GetLocationDetails
tools.summary: Get details of a location.

parameters.name: location_address
parameters.description: The address of the location, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'.

returns.name: location_details
returns.description: The dictionary containing the 'location_name', 'location_address' (string, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'), 'location_rating' (number, between 0 and 5), 'open_now' (optional, indicate whether the location is open now), and 'extra_details' (an object including the phone number and opening hours, and other details depending on the type of the location, such as menu for restaurants.)

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'location_address' does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'location_address' is not in the valid format.

tools.name: GetDirections
tools.summary: Get driving, walking, or public transit directions between two or more locations.

parameters.name: start_location_address
parameters.description: The starting location address, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'. Default is the current location.

parameters.name: end_location
parameters.description: The ending location address, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The mode of transportation, can be 'driving', 'walking', or 'transit'.

returns.name: estimated_time
returns.description: The overall estimated time for the route in the format of 'hours:minutes'.

returns.name: estimated_distance
returns.description: The overall estimated distance for the route in miles.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'mode' argument is not one of 'driving', 'walking', or 'transit', or the 'start_location_address' is not in the valid format, or the 'end_location_address' is not in the valid format.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'start_location_address' does not exist, or the 'end_location_address' does not exist.

tools.name: Geocoding
tools.summary: Convert a location address to geographic coordinates.

parameters.name: location_address
parameters.description: The address of the location, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'.

returns.name: coordinates
returns.description: The geographic coordinates of the location in the format of 'latitude,longitude'.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'location_address' does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'location_address' is not in the valid format.

tools.name: ReverseGeocoding
tools.summary: Convert geographic coordinates to a location address.

parameters.name: coordinates
parameters.description: The geographic coordinates in the format of 'latitude,longitude'.

returns.name: location_address
returns.description: The address of the location, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'coordinates' argument is not in the correct format.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'coordinates' does not exist.

tools.name: GetLocationReviews
tools.summary: Get the contents of reviews of a location.

parameters.name: location_address
parameters.description: The address of the location, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'.

returns.name: reviews
returns.description: The contents of the reviews. Each review object contains 'time' (string, the time when the review was posted, in the format of 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS'), 'rating' (number, the rating of the review), 'username' (string, the username of the reviewer), and 'content' (string, the content of the review).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'location_address' does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'location_address' is not in the valid format.

tools.name: SearchAddressBook
tools.summary: Search for locations in the address book.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: The keywords to search for locations in the address book.

returns.name: addresses
returns.description: The addresses found in the address book. Each address object contains 'location_address' (string, the address of the location in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'), 'name' (string, the name of the location), 'note' (string, the note of the location).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'keywords' argument is empty.

tools.name: AddAddress
tools.summary: Add an address to the address book.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: The address of the location, in the format of 'street address, city, zip code'.

parameters.name: note
parameters.description: The note of the address.

returns.name: success
returns.description: Whether the operation is successful.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'name' argument is empty, or the 'address' argument is not in the valid format, or the 'note' argument is empty.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: The 'name' argument already exists in the address book.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'address' argument does not exist.

description_for_model: A toolkit for controlling an indoor robot to perform a range of tasks in the physical world by navigating through rooms, identifying and manipulating objects, and operating on objects. The robot is able to handle tasks from basic object manipulation to advanced operations such as turning devices on and off, cutting vegetables, pouring a drink, and using tools. The maximum number of objects that the robot can grab at the same time is 5.
description_for_human: Toolkit for controlling an indoor robot to perform indoor tasks.

tools.name: GetCurrentState
tools.summary: Retrieve the current state of the robot, including the room it is currently in and the objects it has grabbed.

returns.name: current_room
returns.description: The unique identifier of the current room where the robot is located.

returns.name: grabbed_objects
returns.description: A list of objects containing information about the objects grabbed by the robot, including details like object_id (the unique identifier of the object, in the format of 'object name' + 'object number', e.g., 'table_1'), object_name (the name of the object), and description (the description of the object).

tools.name: ListRooms
tools.summary: List all the rooms in the building that the robot can navigate to.

returns.name: rooms
returns.description: A list of objects containing information about the rooms in the building, including details like room_name (the name of the room) and room_id (the unique identifier of the room, in the format of 'room name' + 'room number', e.g., 'kitchen_1').

tools.name: GoToRoom
tools.summary: Let the robot safely move to a specified room based on the room's unique identifier. If the robot cannot move to the specified room safely, it will return a message indicating the reason why it cannot move to the specified room safely.

parameters.name: room_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the room to which the robot should move.

returns.name: message
returns.description: A message indicating the robot safely moved to the specified room, or the reason why the robot cannot move to the specified room safely.

returns.name: current_room
returns.description: The unique identifier of the current room where the robot is located after executing the command.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'room_id' parameter does not exist.

tools.name: FindObjects
tools.summary: Let the robot find objects in the current room based on a query. When the robot cannot find any objects that match the query, it will return an empty list.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to find objects in the current room. The query can be a name or a description of the object.

returns.name: objects
returns.description: A list of objects that match the query, each object includes object_id (the unique identifier of the object), object_name (the name of the object), object_location (the description of the object location, composed of relative position words like 'on', 'inside', 'left of', 'near', etc., and the relative object id, e.g., 'on table_1'), description (the description of the object), and can_be_grabbed (a boolean indicating whether the robot can grab the object).

tools.name: LookAroundObject
tools.summary: Let the robot look around a specified object and list all objects around the object in the current room.

parameters.name: object_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the object around which the robot should look.

returns.name: objects
returns.description: A list of objects that are around the specified object, each object contains object_id (the unique identifier of the object), object_name (the name of the object), object_location (the description of the object location, e.g., 'on the table'), description (the description of the object), and can_be_grabbed (a boolean indicating whether the robot can grab the object).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'object_id' parameter does not exist in the current room.

tools.name: GetAllowedOperations
tools.summary: Get allowed operations on a specific target object, optionally using the grabbed objects for interaction. The allowed operations include grabbing, placing, and interacting with the target object. The grabbed objects can be used as tools to interact with the target object, for example, using a knife (grabbed object) to cut an organe (target object). The allowed operations must exclusively be applied on the target object instead of other objects in the room. The allowed operations must be retrieved before applying any allowed operation.

parameters.name: target_object_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the target object.

parameters.name: interact_grabbed_object_ids
parameters.description: A list of unique identifiers of the grabbed objects that will be used to interact with the target object.

returns.name: allowed_operations
returns.description: This parameter refers to an array of objects, each representing an allowed operation on the specifed target object. Each object includes the following properties: 'operation_id' (str) which is a unique identifier for the operation, 'arguments' (object) that denotes the available arguments for the operation along with their valid values or constraints, 'description' (str) that provides an in-depth explanation of the operation's functionality, and 'potential_side_effects' (array) each containing an object with fields 'effect' (str, the potential side effect) and 'probability' (number, the estimated possibility of the side effect occuring on a scale from 0-1).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'target_object_id' does not exist in the current room.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: Any of the 'interact_grabbed_object_ids' parameters do not exist in the grabbed objects.

tools.name: ApplyAllowedOperation
tools.summary: Apply an allowed operation on a specific target object, optionally using the grabbed objects as tools for interaction. The allowed operations must be retrieved using the GetAllowedOperations tool before applying any allowed operation.

parameters.name: target_object_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the target object on which the operation should be applied.

parameters.name: operation_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the operation to be applied. The unique identifier must be retrieved using the GetAllowedOperations tool.

parameters.name: arguments
parameters.description: A dictionary of arguments for the operation. The arguments must match the arguments retrieved using the GetAllowedOperations tool.

returns.name: message
returns.description: A message describing the result of the operation, including the other side effects occurred during the operation. If the operation is failed, the message will indicate the reason why the operation is failed.

returns.name: updated_grabbed_objects
returns.description: A list of objects containing information about the objects grabbed by the robot, including details like object_id (the unique identifier of the object), object_name (the name of the object), and description (the description of the object).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'target_object_id' does not exist, or the 'operation_id' does not exist.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The operation is not valid for the given arguments.

tools.name: FindPeople
tools.summary: Let the robot find people in the current room based on a query. When the robot cannot find any people that match the query, it will return an empty list.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The query to find people in the current room. The query can be a name or a description of the person. If not provided, the robot will find all people in the current room.

returns.name: found_people
returns.description: A list of objects containing information about the people that match the query. Each object includes details like person_id (the unique identifier of the person), person_name (the name of the person, should be 'unknown' if the person is not in identified), person_location (the description of the person location, composed of relative position words like 'on', 'inside', 'left of', 'near', etc., and the relative object id, e.g., 'near table_1'), and description (the description of the person, e.g., the person's appearance).

tools.name: HandObjectsToPerson
tools.summary: Let the robot hand a subset of the grabbed objects to a person.

parameters.name: object_ids
parameters.description: A list of unique identifiers of the objects to be handed to the user. Must be the ids of the grabbed objects.

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the person to whom the objects should be handed. Must be the id of a person in the current room, returned by the FindPeople tool.

returns.name: message
returns.description: A message describing the result of the operation. If the operation is failed, the message will indicate the reason why the operation is failed.

returns.name: updated_grabbed_objects
returns.description: A list of objects containing information about the objects grabbed by the robot, including details like object_id (the unique identifier of the object), object_name (the name of the object), and description (the description of the object).

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: Any of the 'object_ids' parameters do not exist in the grabbed objects, or the 'person_id' parameter does not exist.

category: IoT, Smart Home, and Surveillance Tools
description_for_model: The EmergencyDispatchSystem is designed to handle emergency dispatch requests from 911 operators, targeted towards emergency dispatch centers and public safety organizations in a certain city. It provides functionalities to create dispatch requests, redirect specific dispatch resources, estimate dispatch times, find nearby resources (police, fire, medical, etc.), and issue general calls for dispatch resources. It also allows for retrieval and editing of incident data, as well as retrieval of resource data.
description_for_human: Toolkit for handling emergency dispatch requests from 911 operators.

tools.name: CreateDispatchRequest
tools.summary: Create an active new emergency dispatch request with available resources.

parameters.name: incident_location
parameters.description: The location of the incident in the street address format.

parameters.name: resource_ids
parameters.description: List of unique identifiers for the dispatch resources to be dispatched.

parameters.name: incident_type
parameters.description: The primary type of the incident, one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police'].

parameters.name: incident_severity
parameters.description: The severity of the incident, one of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High'].

parameters.name: incident_description
parameters.description: A brief description of the incident.

returns.name: incident_id
returns.description: The unique identifier of the created dispatch request.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'incident_type' parameter is not one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police'], or the 'incident_severity' parameter is not one of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High'], or if the 'incident_location' is invalid, or at least one resource represented by 'resource_id' is 'Unavailable' or 'Dispatched'.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: At least one 'resource_id' from the 'resource_ids' does not exist.

tools.name: RedirectDispatchResources
tools.summary: Redirect a specific dispatch resources to an already existing incident or a new location. If the location is provided, a new incident will be created and the dispatch resources will be redirected to the new incident.

parameters.name: resource_ids
parameters.description: List of unique identifiers for the dispatch resources to be redirected.

parameters.name: target_type
parameters.description: The type of the target location, one of ['Incident', 'Location'].

parameters.name: incident_id_or_new_location
parameters.description: If 'target_type' is 'Incident', it is 'incident_id' of the incident to which the dispatch resources should be redirected. If 'target_type' is 'Location', it is the 'new_location' to which the dispatch resources should be redirected, in the street address format.

returns.name: redirect_result
returns.description: An object containing a boolean 'success' field indicating whether the redirection was successful. If the 'target_type' is 'Location', the object also contains a 'incident_id' field indicating the unique identifier of the incident that was created as a result of the redirection.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'resource_ids' is not provided, or 'target_type' is not one of ['Incident', 'Location'], or the 'new_location' is invalid if 'target_type' is 'Location', the resource is Unavailable.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'resource_ids' does not exist, or the 'incident_id' does not exist if 'target_type' is 'Incident'.

tools.name: EstimateDispatchTime
tools.summary: Estimate the dispatch time for a specific dispatch resource to reach a specified location.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the dispatch resource.

parameters.name: destination_location
parameters.description: The destination location for the dispatch resource, in the street address format.

returns.name: estimated_time
returns.description: The estimated dispatch time in the format 'HH:mm:ss'.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'resource_id' or 'destination_location' is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: FindNearbyResources
tools.summary: Find nearby dispatch resources based on a specified location and resource type.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location to find nearby dispatch resources, in the street address format.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: The type of the dispatch resources to find, one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police']. If not provided, all types of dispatch resources will be considered.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: nearby_resources
returns.description: An array of objects for nearby dispatch resources, each object contains 'resource_id', 'resource_type' (one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police']), 'resource_location', 'resource_status' (one of ['Available', 'Dispatched', 'Unavailable']), 'incident_id' (the unique identifier of the incident this resource is dispatched to, only included if the resource is Dispatched), 'distance_to_location' (unit miles).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'resource_type' parameter is not one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police'], or if the 'location' is not provided or invalid.

tools.name: GetIncidentData
tools.summary: Retrieve incident data for a specified incident.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the incident to retrieve data for.

returns.name: incident_data
returns.description: The incident data for the specified incident, contains 'incident_id', 'incident_type' (one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police']), 'incident_location', 'incident_severity' (one of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High']), 'incident_status' (one of ['Active', 'Closed']), 'dispatch_resource_ids', 'dispatch_time', 'incident_description'.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'incident_id' is not provided or invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'incident_id' does not exist.

tools.name: GetResourceData
tools.summary: Retrieve data for a specified dispatch resource.

parameters.name: resource_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the dispatch resource to retrieve data for.

returns.name: resource_data
returns.description: The data for the specified dispatch resource, contains 'resource_id', 'resource_type' (one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police']), 'resource_location', 'resource_status' (one of ['Available', 'Dispatched', 'Unavailable']), 'incident_id' (the unique identifier of the incident this resource is dispatched to, null if not dispatched).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'resource_id' is not provided or invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'resource_id' does not exist.

tools.name: EditIncident
tools.summary: Edit the data for a specified incident. This function should be used to assign new resources to an incident unless they have already been notified; it will NOT notify them of the assignment.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the incident to edit.

parameters.name: incident_type
parameters.description: If provided, the new type of the incident, one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police'].

parameters.name: incident_severity
parameters.description: If provided, the new severity of the incident, one of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High'].

parameters.name: incident_description
parameters.description: If provided, the new description of the incident.

parameters.name: incident_status
parameters.description: If provided, the new status of the incident, one of ['Active', 'Closed'].

parameters.name: resource_ids
parameters.description: If provided, the new list of unique identifiers for the dispatch resources assigned to this incident.

returns.name: edit_status
returns.description: The success status of the edit operation.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'incident_id' is not provided or invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The 'incident_id' does not exist.

tools.name: SearchIncidents
tools.summary: Search for incidents based on a specified location and incident type.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location to search for incidents, in the street address format.

parameters.name: incident_type
parameters.description: The type of the incidents to search for, one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police']. If not provided, all types of incidents will be considered.

parameters.name: severity
parameters.description: The severity of the incidents to search for, one of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High']. If not provided, all severities of incidents will be considered.

parameters.name: incident_status
parameters.description: If provided, the new status of the incident, one of ['Active', 'Closed'].

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is 10.

returns.name: incidents
returns.description: An array of incidents that match the search criteria, each object contains 'incident_id', 'incident_type' (one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police']), 'incident_location', 'incident_severity' (one of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High']), 'incident_status' (one of ['Active', 'Closed']), 'dispatch_resource_ids', 'dispatch_time', 'incident_description'.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The 'incident_type' parameter is not one of ['Fire', 'Medical', 'Police'], or if the 'severity' parameter is not one of ['Low', 'Medium', 'High'], or if the 'location' is invalid.

description_for_model: A toolkit for interacting with the Ethereum blockchain, allowing users to create and manage Ethereum accounts, deploy and interact with smart contracts, transfer Ether, and query blockchain data. It also provides tools for compiling Solidity code, estimating gas costs, and signing and verifying messages.
description_for_human: Toolkit for interacting with the Ethereum blockchain.

tools.name: DeploySmartContract
tools.summary: Deploy a new smart contract on the Ethereum blockchain.

parameters.name: contract_bytecode
parameters.description: The bytecode for the smart contract.

parameters.name: constructor_args
parameters.description: An array of arguments for the smart contract constructor.

parameters.name: gas_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of gas to be used for the deployment. Optional.

returns.name: contract_address
returns.description: The Ethereum address of the deployed smart contract.

returns.name: transaction_hash
returns.description: The hash of the transaction used to deploy the smart contract.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The contract bytecode or constructor arguments are invalid.

exceptions.name: ConflictException
exceptions.description: A contract with the same address already exists.

tools.name: CallSmartContractFunction
tools.summary: Interact with a deployed smart contract by calling one of its functions.

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description: The Ethereum address of the deployed smart contract.

parameters.name: function_name
parameters.description: The name of the function to call.

parameters.name: function_args
parameters.description: An array of arguments for the function call.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The amount of Ether to send with the function call. Optional (defaults to 0).

parameters.name: gas_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of gas to be used for the function call. Optional.

returns.name: return_value
returns.description: The return value of the function call.

returns.name: transaction_hash
returns.description: The hash of the transaction used to call the function (if applicable).

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The contract address, function name, or function arguments are invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The contract does not exist.

tools.name: TransferEther
tools.summary: Transfer Ether between Ethereum accounts.

parameters.name: from_address
parameters.description: The Ethereum address of the sender.

parameters.name: to_address
parameters.description: The Ethereum address of the recipient.

parameters.name: amount_ether
parameters.description: The amount of Ether to transfer.

parameters.name: gas_limit
parameters.description: The maximum amount of gas to be used for the transfer. Optional.

returns.name: transaction_hash
returns.description: The hash of the transaction used to transfer the Ether.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The from_address, to_address, or amount_ether are invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The from_address or to_address does not exist.

tools.name: CreateEthereumAccount
tools.summary: Create a new Ethereum account with a private key.

returns.name: account_address
returns.description: The Ethereum address of the created account.

returns.name: private_key
returns.description: The private key for the created account.

tools.name: ImportEthereumAccount
tools.summary: Import an existing Ethereum account using its private key.

parameters.name: private_key
parameters.description: The private key of the existing Ethereum account.

returns.name: account_address
returns.description: The Ethereum address of the imported account.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The private key is invalid.

tools.name: EstimateGasCost
tools.summary: Estimate the gas cost for a smart contract function call.

parameters.name: contract_address
parameters.description: The Ethereum address of the deployed smart contract.

parameters.name: function_name
parameters.description: The name of the function to call.

parameters.name: function_args
parameters.description: An array of arguments for the function call.

returns.name: gas_estimate
returns.description: The estimated gas cost for the function call.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The contract address, function name, or function arguments are invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The contract does not exist.

tools.name: CompileSolidity
tools.summary: Compile Solidity code into bytecode.

parameters.name: contract_code
parameters.description: The Solidity code for the smart contract.

returns.name: bytecode
returns.description: The compiled bytecode of the Solidity code.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The contract code is invalid.

tools.name: SignMessage
tools.summary: Sign a message using an Ethereum account's private key.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to be signed.

parameters.name: private_key
parameters.description: The private key of the Ethereum account.

returns.name: signature
returns.description: The signature of the message.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The message or private key are invalid.

tools.name: VerifyMessage
tools.summary: Verify a signed message using the Ethereum account's address.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to be verified.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature of the message.

parameters.name: account_address
parameters.description: The Ethereum address of the account.

returns.name: is_valid
returns.description: Whether the signature is valid for the given message and account address.

exceptions.name: InvalidRequestException
exceptions.description: The message, signature, or account_address are invalid.

exceptions.name: NotFoundException
exceptions.description: The account_address does not exist.
